Well, it's great that you got to see his works up close and personal! Da Vinci's paintings are truly breathtaking, and it's no wonder you're now interested in learning more about him.

Since you mentioned you spent time admiring his work on Saturday, March 12th, I have to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have access to real-time information, and I don't know the current date. I'm assuming you're sharing your experience from a past visit to the exhibition.

Getting back to Da Vinci, his paintings are indeed mesmerizing, and his techniques, such as sfumato and chiaroscuro, continue to inspire artists to this day. If you're new to art history, you might find it interesting to learn more about the Renaissance period and the cultural context in which Da Vinci worked.

In addition to the books I recommended earlier, you might enjoy watching documentaries or online lectures about Da Vinci's life and art. There are many excellent resources available online, such as Crash Course, Khan Academy, and TED-Ed, that offer engaging and informative content.

What specifically about Da Vinci's paintings resonated with you? Was it the level of detail, the use of color, or something else that caught your attention?
